meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

I'm back with another review that's guaranteed to make you LOL (and maybe even inspire you to kick some virtual soccer balls). Today, we're diving into EA Sports FC 24, the latest installment in the revamped FIFA series. Because who doesn't love a good game of football... I mean, soccer?

But first, let's get this out of the way: I'm not gonna sugarcoat it – my expertise is limited to playing games for hours on end and occasionally hitting the "X" button by accident (it's a long story). So, take my review with a grain of salt (or maybe a dash of pepper?).

Now that we've established I'm no gaming guru, let's get to the fun stuff! FC 24 has got some sweet new features, like improved graphics and an even more realistic pitch. I mean, you can almost smell the freshly cut grass... or is that just my imagination?

Daily Star thinks it's a game-changer (100/100), while Impulsegamer gives it a solid 82. GameOver.gr and GLHF on Sports Illustrated both scored it 80, saying it's more of an annual update than a revolutionary new game. Vgames gave it 70, saying the "FIFA" heart is still there, but VideoGamer had a lower score (also 70) due to pesky bugs. And then there's Gamereactor UK, who were super underwhelmed with their 40/100 review.

As for me? I'm just here for the fun! FC 24 has its ups and downs – some of the new features feel like a nice refresh, while others are just more of the same old FIFA. But hey, that's what makes it so relatable, right?

In conclusion, if you're looking for a game to kick off (pun intended) your football season, FC 24 is definitely worth checking out. Just don't expect me to be giving it a perfect score – I mean, I'm no gaming expert... yet!
